item.title: Report X-2024080566
item.description:
Report X-2024080566

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: SALEM
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: QA personnel was called to Trailer #830652 for a potential HAZMAT package that was leaking; inspection of package verified that there was a leak of a Class 8 HAZMAT containing four individual 1 gallon jugs of sulfuric acid from the DIYchemicals/Cheboys brand. Package was isolated into a red tote and removed to the station HAZMAT cage to begin damaged package process for HAZMATs. Further inspection of the package interior verified that one out of four bottles of sulfuric acid had a loosened safety cap, resulting in the gradual spill of its contents inside the package, which remained mostly contained inside the package. Some of the cardboard box the items came in was eaten away from the spillage. There was also little to no inner packing material inside the package securing the hazardous items; there was a little bit of bubble packaging material inside, but not enough to secure the bottles, which allowed for space inside for the items to move around inside the package during transport, which resulted in damage and spillage occurring.

item.title: Report X-2024080504
item.description:
Report X-2024080504

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE LEAKING CLASS 8 HAZMAT WAS FOUND IN DOOR 11. THE LIQUID THAT HAD SPILLED ON THE TRAILER FLOOR FROM THE PACKAGE HAD A NEUTRAL PH AND WAS CLEANED UP WITH ZEP ZORBENT. THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND AFFECTED MATERIAL WERE CONTAINED IN A SPILL TOTE AND RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. ALL MERCHANDISE WAS DAMAGED BY THE SPILL AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024080007
item.description:
Report E-2024080007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PHILLIPS 66
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28,2024 at 0634 ET, Love's Travel-Travel Stop 449 reported a diesel fuel release at store 449 in Troutdale, OR. The release was caused by an overflow of the UST. Loves stated that the same issue took place yesterday. Chris is requesting the same work to be performed. Recover the absorbent pads deployed by Loves Personnel, pressure wash the impacted area and recover the rise water utilizing a vac truck. Chris was not sure if a nearby drain basin was impacted. The responding vendor also needs to check the OWS incase that needs to be pumped out as well.

item.title: Report E-2024080025
item.description:
Report E-2024080025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 24, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jerrican of UN3214 was punctured and released approximately three (3) ounces to the pallet and dock floor below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GME) to remediate the impacted site. Crews over-packed the damaged 5-gallon jerrican into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum for terminal disposal. GME then utilized absorbent pads and cleaners to the impacted pallet and dock floor. Crews placed impacted PPE and absorbent pads into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail
